questions.question: What is the name of the special method used to initialize a new object?
questions.explanation: The __init__ method is the standard constructor in Python classes.

questions.question: When does the __init__ method run?

options.text: Automatically when a new object is created
Only when you call it manually
Every time a method is called

questions.explanation: Python calls __init__ immediately after the object is instantiated.

questions.question: How do you define an attribute called 'score' inside the constructor?
questions.explanation: Using 'self.' attaches the variable to the specific instance of the object.

questions.question: Arrange the signature of an __init__ method correctly:
questions.explanation: The constructor always starts with def __init__, then self, then your custom arguments.
